Create an OpenSim External Loads XML File

Source: R/setup_external_loads_osim.R
setup_external_loads_osim.Rd

This function creates an OpenSim External Loads XML setup file for applying external forces (e.g., ground reaction forces) to a model. It is useful for preparing input files for inverse dynamics or forward simulations.

Usage

setup_external_loads_osim(
  setup_filename = "external_loads.xml",
  set_name = c("right", "left"),
  set_applied_body_name = c("calcn_r", "calcn_l"),
  force_expressed_in_body_name = "ground",
  point_expressed_in_body_name = "ground",
  set_force_identifier = c("X1_force_", "X2_force_"),
  set_point_identifier = c("X1_point_", "X2_point_"),
  set_torque_identifier = c("X1_torque_", "X2_torque_"),
  data_source_name = "grf.mot",
  write_file = TRUE,
  return_object = FALSE
)

Arguments

setup_filename

Character. Name of the XML file to write (default: `"external_loads.xml"`).

set_name

Character vector. Names of the external load elements (e.g., `"right"`, `"left"`).

set_applied_body_name

Character vector. Names of the bodies to which each load is applied (e.g., `"calcn_r"`).

force_expressed_in_body_name

Character. Body in which forces are expressed.

point_expressed_in_body_name

Character. Body in which point locations are expressed.

set_force_identifier

Character vector. Identifiers for force data columns in the `.mot` file (e.g., `"fx_"`).

set_point_identifier

Character vector. Identifiers for point location columns in the `.mot` file (e.g., `"px_"`).

set_torque_identifier

Character vector. Identifiers for torque data columns in the `.mot` file (e.g., `"tx_"`).

data_source_name

Character. Name of the `.mot` file providing the external load data.

write_file

Logical. If `TRUE`, writes the XML file to disk (default: `TRUE`).

return_object

Logical. If `TRUE`, returns the `ExternalLoads` OpenSim object (default: `FALSE`).

Value

Invisibly returns the `opensim::ExternalLoads` object if `return_object = TRUE`.

Details

Each external load set in OpenSim must specify: * a **body** the load is applied to, * **force/point/torque identifiers** (prefixes in the `.mot` file), * and the **data source** (e.g., GRF `.mot` file).

This function automates building such XML configurations, supporting multiple load sets (e.g., left and right foot).
